ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: i learned about many of the different challenges in the family dynamics of greek families in the literature and films we read. specifically, a lot about incest and murders. i learned how to improve my writing and critical thinking skills. my analysis improved.
I developed in countless ways as a writer, as a reader and as a thinker. Professor Syrimis has become one of my mentors and I will be forever grateful for all that he has taught me!
I learned a lot about Greek history, as well as literary and filmic styles, that I didn't know before. I also got to reinforce my film studies skills that I hadn't practiced in a while.
I learned how to better strip my writing down to its core ideas, removing excess content in order to create a more focused and fluid piece.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
strengths: interesting seminar discussions, small class size facilitates greater learning, professor syrimis cares a lot about the subject matter and his analysis of the text/films were enlightening
weaknesses: sometimes the material can be uncomfortable
I would not change this course in any way -- it is already amazing! The readings and the films are great and the discussions themselves are very enjoyable and engaging.
I like that this course requires a lot of writing and weekly engagement with the texts. I also really enjoyed the presentation assignment.

I enjoyed the discussion based nature of the course as well as the student moderation. However, I wish that the discussion was tailored to cover the text more broadly. The class would often get entrenched in one aspect of the reading and we would not get to discuss other important topics due to time constraints. Also, while I did enjoy the task of thinking about the texts through the response papers, I think that having one paper a week did not allow me to fully develop my ideas and produce a polished product.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: would recommend. interesting material like no other class i have ever taken and the small class size helps facilitate learning.
Yes! It is a wonderful experience, so please take it.

I would recommend this course to any student who thinks the texts studied look interesting, and also any non-major who's interested in branching out into film studies and wants a course that is accessible to all.

extras.title:
MGRK 218 01/FILM 243 01/WGSS 245 01
        Family in Greek Lit & Film TR
